overview:
Susan Coelius Keplinger is a San Francisco entrepreneur. Susan is currently the co-founder of Triggit, an online advertising technology company building technologies around ad buying on the real time display advertising exchanges. Triggit was started in the fall of 2005, and is currently venture funded.

A graduate of Northwestern University, Susan co-founded Votes for Students, a Pew Trusts funded non-profit, while in college. VFS empowered student participation in the political process with the firstâ€“ever national bipartisan GOTV email marketing campaign. Other business forays include a pin hustle at multiple Olympics, and financing college through home renovation and repair.

Beyond her entrepreneurial pursuits Susan is an avid athlete and can often be found kitesurfing at Chrissy field, skiing the backcountries of Tahoe, or on the pitch playing soccer for the Olympic Club.
